content.question: The claims made by White and Hahn about United States policies toward American Indians in the late nineteenth century are similar in that they both support which of the following arguments?

choices.label: The federal government sought to grant members of American Indian tribes United States citizenship.
The United States Congress saw treaties as the best way to promote American Indian economic development.
Federal officials desired to encourage the adoption of White American lifestyles by American Indians.
The United States wanted to force American Indians to provide labor for agriculture and mining.

content.answer: Federal officials desired to encourage the adoption of White American lifestyles by American Indians.

topic.text: 6.3: Westward Expansion - Social and Cultural Development
